job_title: Digital Marketing Specialist in Kingston, ON
pros:
I worked for SLC as a student worker in multiple departments and always was given the opportunity to try new things, learn new skills, and get experience in the field I was pursuing. I got great hands on experience in my field prior to graduation. 

Departments also respect student's academics and work around class schedules easily for work shifts!
cons: As a student worker I could only work before office hours stopped at 4:30pm.

pros: working with this institution makes you feel in a very diverse and inclusive enviorment.
cons: Though competition for getting employed at the same college where one has studied.

pros: Support staff are deeply committed to student success
cons: Coordination and communication is a challenge

review_title: No loyalty to support staff, unpaid overtime
pros: Great place to work if you know the right people and know how to network. Decent people, comfortable environment. Good values as a company.
cons:
If you aren't a member of the bargaining unit, which more than half of their employees are not, say goodbye to any sort of job stability. If a manager sees an opportunity to save a couple bucks on the budget, they will gladly run your contract out and put the rest of their staff on unpaid overtime to make up for the loss in productivity. 
Very little room for growth in this company as most employees are content to keep the same position for a decade or more.
lack of job security and culture of have/have not. Part time vs full time.  Major morale problems. Major rifts created.

pros:
- Learn something new Everyday
- A positive environment to work
cons: No easy way for students to access their paystubs
